etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in William Hillebrand (1821–1886). From Hawaiian (Kauai) mokihana

definitions: A Hawaiian tree, Pelea anisata (family Rutaceae), having highly scented seed pods used in garlands.

notes.text: The mokihana is peculiar to the island of Kauai, and garlands of its seed pods are regarded as emblematic of this island.
